titleStmt.title: A complete history of England from the first entrance of the Romans under the conduct of Julius Cæsar unto the end of the reign of King Henry III ... : wherein is shewed the original of our English laws, the differences and disagreements between the secular and ecclesiastic powers ... and likewise an account of our foreign wars with France, the conquest of Ireland, and the actions between the English, Scots and Welsh ... : all delivered in plain matter of fact, without any reflections or remarques by Robert Brady ...
titleStmt.author: Brady, Robert, 1627?-1700.

titleStmt.title: A complete history of England from the first entrance of the Romans under the conduct of Julius Cæsar unto the end of the reign of King Henry III ... : wherein is shewed the original of our English laws, the differences and disagreements between the secular and ecclesiastic powers ... and likewise an account of our foreign wars with France, the conquest of Ireland, and the actions between the English, Scots and Welsh ... : all delivered in plain matter of fact, without any reflections or remarques by Robert Brady ...
titleStmt.author: Brady, Robert, 1627?-1700.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Newcomb for Samuel Lowndes ...,

notesStmt.note: In 1700 the author issued a supplementary volume under title: Continuation of the complete history of England.
Reproduction of original in British Library.
"A catalogue of authors used in this history": [8] p. following p. lxviii.
Includes: Appendix of official documents (charters, letters, proclamations, etc.) in Latin, some with English translation.
